Commands

The Commands section contains the command channels for the add-on. To use the command channels, first set the meta data channels to the desired value. Then set the command channel to the desired value. Command and meta data pairs are as follows.

ReadDIDs - Command Value: 1 - Meta Data: N/A

ReadDID - Command Value: 2 - Meta Data: DID ID

ReadPIDsOnDemand - Command Value: 3 - Meta Data: N/A

ReadPIDOnDemand - Command Value: 4 - Meta Data: PID ID

ConfigureandStartPIDs - Command Value: 5 - Meta Data: N/A

StopPIDs - Command Value: 6 - Meta Data: N/A

ReadDTCByDTCNumber - Command Value: 7 - Meta Data: DTC Number, FailureType

StartDTCs - Command Value: 8 - Meta Data: DTC Status Mask

EnableChangeDTCCount - Command Value: 9 - Meta Data: DTC Status Mask

DisableChangeDTCCount - Command Value: 10 - Meta Data: N/A

ClearDTCs - Command Value: 11 - Meta Data: N/A

DisableNormalCommunication - Command Value: 12 - Meta Data: N/A

ReturnToNormalMode - Command Value: 13 - Meta Data: N/A

Read Failure Rcord Parameters - Command Value: 14 - Meta Data: DTC ID, DTCFailureType, failureRecordNumber

ClearDiagnosticCommandSuccess - Command Value: 15 - Meta Data: N/A
